DataElement.preferredName: Testicular Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for testicular carcinoma based on evidence obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Clinical N Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. mc 1/31/17

ValueDomain.preferredName: Testicular Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Clinical N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer cN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer cN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with metastasis with a lymph node mass larger than 2 cm but not larger than 5 cm in greatest dimension or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass larger than 2 cm but not larger than 5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer cN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with metastasis with a lymph node mass larger than 2 cm but not larger than 5 cm in greatest dimension or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass larger than 2 cm but not larger than 5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer cN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer cN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with metastases in a lymph node mass 2 cm or smaller in greatest dimension or multiple lymph nodes, none larger than 2 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer cN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with metastases in a lymph node mass 2 cm or smaller in greatest dimension or multiple lymph nodes, none larger than 2 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer cN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer cN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with no regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer cN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with no regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer cNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer cNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer cNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer cN3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer cN3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with metastasis with a lymph node mass larger than 5 cm in greatest dimensi. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer cN3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with metastasis with a lymph node mass larger than 5 cm in greatest dimensi. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
